Posts.Content: newtobc13 wrote: A very close relative has been diagnosed with Inflammatory BC and Invasive Ductal carcinoma..the local docs misdiagnosed at first, and then the big docs took about 4 weeks to get all their testing done..she still has not started treatment.  She is HER2 negative (we hope).  She said it has spread to her lymph nodes, neck, chest cavity and are waiting on results of a bone biopsy..the big doc was SURE she was HER2 + and had to switch things around when the test came back -.. delaying treatment yet another week.  My question is is this considered stage III or Stage IV?  she said the doctor told her it was stage III  ...?  which makes me wonder..thank you so much.. concerned loved one.. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confused- Stage III or Stage IV? newtobc13 Faith316

Posts.Content: May 28, 2011 05:42PM newtobc13 wrote: Wow.  That was hard to read.  Thank you so much for your help and kind words..I know she had a CATscan to see if it was in her liver but she hasn't offered those results and I don't want to just ask, I know we are all thinking positive thoughts that the bone biopsy comes back clean..she starts chemo next week and they are putting her in a study trial for some drug that prevents the cancer from creating bloodcells..it's a phase 3 study but usually used for lung/colon cancer..I guess time will tell and in meantime I'll remember to breathe and not focus on it too much..thank you all so so much!
Posts.Title: Confused- Stage III or Stage IV? newtobc13 Faith316

Posts.Content: May 29, 2011 02:42PM newtobc13 wrote: Thanks MJL..she stars hormone therapy, taxans and Avastin in a couple days..she has allergies/asthma and a very sensitive system so I'm hoping she doesn't have horrible side effects from any of these drugs..there are giving her benadryl and steroids to help counteract anything before she starts.. *keeping my fingers crossed*
Posts.Title: Confused- Stage III or Stage IV? newtobc13 Faith316

Posts.Content: May 28, 2011 03:57PM newtobc13 wrote: Thank you all so much for your quick replies...can I ask one more question?..does being Stage III or StageIV change the course of treatment at all or is it the same for both stages?  thanks..
